items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: Flooding is possible from today, Friday 24th October 2025, and over the weekend. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels will remain high over the next couple of days. We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Saturday 25th October 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Mole and its tributaries from Kinnersley Manor to South Hersham
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Cuckmere River
items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Further rainfall is forecast but no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: The tidal River Yare from Thorpe St Andrew to Breydon Water
items.message: Flooding is possible from today, Friday 24th October, and over the weekend. This is due to tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, over the next three days may lead to flooding. We expect to see high water levels in Brundall and Reedham riverside areas. River levels will remain high over the next couple of days. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities.  This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Saturday 25th October 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal River Waveney from Ellingham to Breydon Water
items.message: Flooding is possible from today, Friday 24th October 2025, and over the weekend. We expect to see high water levels at Beccles Quay. River levels will remain high over the next couple of days. We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Saturday 25th October 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The Suffolk coast at Southwold
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 10:30 am to 2pm today, Saturday 25th October 2025. 
We expect high tide levels at the harbourside in Southwold. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Lowestoft of 1.83mAODN at 12.15pm, today, Saturday 25th October 2025, which is 0.90m above tide tables, Wind Force 7, North Westerly. Tides will remain high over the next couple of days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 25 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including tidal River Esk
items.message: High tides, strong winds and large waves this morning may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from 5:30AM to 12:00PM on 25/10/25. Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths along the North Sea coast from Staithes to Whitby including Sandsend and tidal River Esk. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded. Also avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 25 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Tidal Thames riverside from Putney Bridge to Teddington Weir
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.county: Greater London, Hammersmith and Fulham, Hounslow, Richmond upon Thames, Wandsworth

items.message:
High tides today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 4:00 PM to 6:00 PM on 25/10/2025. 
The forecast high tide at Richmond is 4.72mAOD at 5:00 PM on 25/10/2025.

We believe there is a possibility of flooding for Putney Embankment (SW15), Chiswick Mall and Strand on the Green (W4), Thames Bank at Mortlake (SW14), Ranelagh Drive (TW1), Friars Lane and Water Lane (TW9), Riverside and The Embankment at Twickenham, and the Towpath below Teddington Lock. Flooding of properties is not expected.

Astronomical tide levels are falling. The river flow at Teddington Weir is 22 cubic metres per second and is steady. We anticipate the flows to remain steady for the next few days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 8:00PM on 25 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding is possible from 8:30AM to 12:00PM on 25/10/25. 
Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths along the North Sea coast from Skipsea to Mappleton, including Hornsea. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . Also avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 9:00AM on 25 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Hunstanton coast in Norfolk
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions tomorrow morning may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from 06:45 to 10:45am on 25.10.2025. 
Areas most at risk are around Hunstanton seafront.  Flood gates in the area will be closed by the Local Authority which will make access difficult. The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  King's Lynn of 3.74mAODN at  08:45am on Saturday  25 which is 0.67m above tide tables, wind force 7, north westerly direction. Tides will remain high over the next couple of days. 
We are liaising with emergency services and local authorities . 
Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 12:00PM on 25 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:

The previous tide of concern has now passed,  the weather is more settled and no flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
If you have been evacuated only return to your property once the emergency services have advised that it is safe to do so. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

items.description: The Suffolk coast from Lowestoft to Bawdsey
items.message:
High tides and forecast weather conditions today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible 10.30am to 2pm on 25 October 2025 
We expect to see high water levels in Lake Lothing in Lowestoft as well as high sea levels along the Suffolk Coast, impacting on beach access points.  The detailed forecast is for a peak level at  Lowestoft of 1.83 mAODN at 12.15pm, today, Saturday 25 October 2025, which is 0.90m above tide tables, Wind Force 7, North Westerly. Tides will remain high over the next couple of days. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded . 
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 25 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Riverside properties along the tidal River Yare including Cantley, Brundall and Reedham
items.message:
Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, is expected to cause flooding this afternoon.  
Flooding is expected from 2pm to 5pm on Saturday 25 October 2025  
Areas most at risk are in Reedham, Cantley and Brundall. Roads affected include Ferry Road in Reedham, the A47 and the railway line between Reedham and Brundall. River levels will remain high over the next couple of days.  
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels .  
Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded .  
This message will be updated by 6:00PM on 25 October 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: North Sea at Sandsend
items.message:
High tides, strong winds and large waves are expected to cause flooding this morning. 
Flooding is expected from 7:45AM to 11:00AM on 25/10/25. 
Locations most affected will be the sea front (A174) and properties adjacent to the road. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. We are in a period of hightides and will update this warning as necessary. 
Avoid coastal roads, footpaths and carparks, which may be flooded. Also avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 9:00PM on 25 October 2025 or as the situation changes.
